Authorities have launched an appeal for a lost rifle after a forgetful sheriff's deputy left his weapon on the trunk of his car and drove off.
The Orange County officer, assigned to the Aliso Viejo station, lost his AR-15 patrol rifle when he was preparing for his shift, shortly before 7pm on Tuesday.
Described as a black, semi-automatic, .223-caliber Colt AR-15 with a 20-inch barrel and serial No. A0091856, the weapon was inside a black case with three loaded magazines.
Lost: An Orange County Sheriff's deputy left a patrol rifle like this on the trunk of his car before driving off
According to a statement released by the Orange County Sheriff's Department he 'became distracted and drove off before securing it [the weapon] inside his vehicle.'
However, what is more shocking is that he didn't realize the weapon was missing until hours later at 3.15am on Wednesday.
Volunteers, bloodhounds and investigators have since searched the streets of Aliso Viejo and Laguna Hills, where the officer had been patrolling, but the rifle has not been found.
The Orange County Sheriff's department has also tweeted about the loss of the rifle in the hope that someone will see the post and hand the weapon in.
The Orange County Sheriff's Department, pictured, has launched an appeal for any information on the lost rifle
Anyone with information has been asked to call the Sheriff's Department at 714-647-7000.
